task_summary: The robot navigates through a hallway toward the goal location, adjusting heading and position until the goal is reached.

task_long_description.overview: This behavior tree guides a mobile robot navigating an indoor corridor environment. The contact sheet frames show a hallway with wooden doors and a blue marker in the distance, interpreted as the goal region. The plan emphasizes repeated checking of goal proximity and retry attempts in case of localization drift or occlusions.
preconditions: Robot initialized at start of hallway
Goal location known and mapped as 'goal'
stepwise_plan: Check if the robot is already at the goal.
If not, initiate navigation toward the goal using NavigateToNamed.
Wait briefly and periodically verify progress with IsAt(goal).
Repeat navigation and verification cycles until success.
If navigation fails, retry up to 3 times.
success_criteria: Robot reaches the goal location and maintains stable position within tolerance.
failure_and_recovery: If path planning fails or localization error occurs, retry navigation.
task_long_description.termination: Tree terminates when IsAt(goal) succeeds or retries are exhausted.

frame_3.now_evidence: First strong visual cue of goal alignment and forward motion.
frame_3.predicts_next: Goal proximity increases; expected deceleration toward target.
frame_3.uncertainty_reduction: Highâ€”visual features of goal region are clear.

node_specs.description: Checks if robot is at the goal location.
Drives the robot toward a named location using navigation stack.
Short wait to stabilize and verify progress.

recovery_strategy: Retry navigation sequence up to 3 times
assumptions: Frames show hallway navigation consistent with 'Navigate to goal'. No manipulable objects visible.

expected_success_criteria: Robot stops near blue marker at corridor end.
